perturbation.original_text: The term of this agreement will begin on April 1, 2018 and continue until April 30, 2018 at 11:59pm.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this agreement will begin on April 1, 2018 and continue indefinitely, subject to termination as outlined herein.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract clearly states a defined term. Changing it to 'indefinitely' introduces ambiguity about the contract's duration. Florida law recognizes contracts with defined terms; an 'indefinite' term could lead to disputes about enforceability and potentially violate statutes requiring clarity in contractual obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida contract law regarding definiteness of terms and duration.

perturbation.original_text: Sponsor shall indemnify and hold harmless, Fruit of Life Productions LLC, its related entities, partners, agents, officers, directors, employees, attorneys, heirs, successors, and assigns from against any and all claims, losses, damages, judgments, settlements, costs and expenses (including reasonable attorney's fees and expenses), and liabilities of every kind incurred as a result of: (i) any act or omission by Sponsor or its officers, directors, entities, employees, agents; (ii) any use of Sponsor's name, logo, Website, or other information, products, or service provided by Sponsor; and/or (iii) the inaccuracy or breach of any of the covenants, representations and warranties made by Sponsor in this Agreement. (iv) any changes in company value or brand value. The attendance and marketing reach estimates made in negotiations were made for the purposes of this agreement are mere estimate and not be interpreted as guaranties.
perturbation.changed_text: Sponsor shall indemnify Fruit of Life Productions LLC from all inconveniences. This agreement's marketing estimates will be considered guarantees.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'indemnify and hold harmless...from any and all claims, losses, damages...' to 'indemnify from all inconveniences' significantly narrows the scope of indemnification, potentially contradicting Florida law regarding the comprehensive nature of indemnification clauses. Also, stating the marketing estimates were guarantees will be a misrepresentation of data, which will contradict Florida's advertising law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida law regarding indemnification and contract law regarding misrepresentation.

perturbation.original_text: In case of a dispute, the parties agree to pursue Arbitration as the preferred method to seek a remedy and the parties waive the right to a jury trial.
perturbation.changed_text: In case of a dispute, Fruit of Life Productions LLC, at its sole discretion, will determine the method to seek remedy. Eco Science Solutions, Inc. agrees to waive any dispute resolution, including but not limited to, the right to a jury trial.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement states both parties prefer Arbitration, and both waive a jury trial. Modifying it to allow Fruit of Life Productions LLC to unilaterally decide the method of remedy and forcing Eco Science Solutions, Inc. to waive dispute resolution contradicts Florida law requiring mutual agreement for arbitration clauses and potentially violates due process rights. This is because it eliminates Eco Science Solutions, Inc.'s ability to seek a remedy.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida Arbitration Code, Florida Rules of Civil Procedure, and Due Process rights.
